required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of INCB054828 in Subjects With Myeloid/Lymphoid Neoplasms With FGFR1 Rearrangement
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Open-Label, Monotherapy, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of INCB054828 in Subjects With Myeloid/Lymphoid Neoplasms With FGFR1 Rearrangement

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of INCB054828 in subjects with myeloid/lymphoid neoplasms with fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) 1 rearrangement.

primary_outcome.measure: Overall clinical benefit rate based on response criteria for myeloid/lymphoid neoplasms with FGFR1 rearrangement
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at protocol-defined timepoints through end of study, up to approximately 24 months.
primary_outcome.description: Clinical benefit rate defined as the proportion of subjects who achieved a complete response (CR), partial response (PR), complete hematologic response (CHR), cytogenetic response, marrow response, or clinical benefit.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at protocol-defined timepoints through end of study, up to approximately 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from the date when the subject first achieves response/benefit until the date of the first documented disease progression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the date of first study drug dose until the date of disease progression or until death due to any cause, whichever is earlier, assessed up to approximately 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from the first date of taking study drug until the date of disease progression, as measured by response criteria for myeloid/lymphoid neoplasms with FGFR1 rearrangement, or until death due to any cause, whichever is earlier.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first study drug dose until death due to any cause, assessed up to approximately 24 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from the first day of taking study drug until death due to any cause. Subjects without death observed at the time of the analysis will be censored at last date known to be alive.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability as assessed by frequency, duration, and severity of adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline through 30-35 days after end of treatment, up to 7 months per individual subject
secondary_outcome.description: A treatment-emergent AE was defined as an event occurring after exposure to at least 1 dose of study drug. A treatment-related AE was defined as an event with a definite, probable, or possible causality to study medication. A serious AE is an event resulting in death, hospitalization, persistent or significant disability/incapacity, or is life threatening, a congenital anomaly/birth defect or requires medical or surgical intervention to prevent 1 of the outcomes above. The intensity of an AE was graded according to the National Cancer Institute common terminology criteria for adverse events (NCI-CTCAE) version 4.03: Grade 1 (Mild); Grade 2 (Moderate); Grade 3 (Severe); Grade 4 (life-threatening).

intervention.description: INCB054828 at the protocol-defined once-daily dose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Documented lymphoid or myeloid neoplasm with 8p11 rearrangement known to lead to FGFR1 activation, based on standard diagnostic cytogenetic evaluation performed locally, before signing informed consent for this study.
- Subjects must be relapsed/refractory. Prior stem cell transplantation is allowed.
- Life expectancy ≥ 12 weeks.
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0 to 2.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior receipt of a selective FGFR inhibitor.
- History and/or current evidence of ectopic mineralization/calcification, including but not limited to soft tissue, kidneys, intestine, myocardia, or lung, except calcified lymph nodes and asymptomatic arterial or cartilage/tendon calcifications.
- Current evidence of corneal disorder/keratopathy, including but not limited to bullous/band keratopathy, corneal abrasion, inflammation/ulceration, and keratoconjunctivitis, as confirmed by ophthalmologic examination.
- Use of any potent cytochrome P450 3A4 inhibitors or inducers within 14 days or 5 half-lives (whichever is shorter) before the first dose of study drug.
